author: Helena Horton
title: Cadbury is producing an exciting new flavour of Creme Egg

organizations.name: cadbury dairy milk egg ‚Äòn‚Äô spoon oreo
cadbury dairy milk oreo shell egg

text:
Cadbury is producing an exciting new flavour of Creme Egg The Creme Egg has landed in New Zealand Credit: Instagram 11 January 2017 ‚Ä¢ 9:50am 
C hristmas is over, which means retailers are already getting ready for Easter. 
Whereas some prefer to have a few high-end chocolates to savour, others endure the headache-inducing sweetness of the humble Creme Egg. 
These little treats have been the topic of controversy of late, with some angry they changed the recipe to no longer feature Dairy Milk chocolate. 
However, some boycotting the sweet treat may soon stop now the new flavour has been released. A photo posted by JunkBanter.com üç´üç∫üí™üèº (@junkbanter) on Jan 5, 2017 at 7:01pm PST 
I t has been confirmed the company has rolled out Oreo Creme Eggs, and they are already available in UK stores. 
A spokesperson for Cadbury told The Metro:"We are always innovating our product ranges and there are lots of exciting things to come from the Cadbury brand this year and beyond. 
"As part of our Easter range this year we have launched new Cadbury Dairy Milk Egg ‚Äòn‚Äô Spoon Oreo, which will be available alongside our existing Oreo Easter products including the Cadbury Dairy Milk Oreo Shell Egg and the Cadbury Dairy Milk Oreo Easter Egg Sharing Bag." Watch | Michael Deacon doesn't like Creme Eggs 01:03 
I nstead of gloopy icing sugar, the eggs are packed with Oreo cream and crushed up biscuit. 
The packaging is different too; instead of the purple, red and yellow foil wrap Creme Eggs pleasingly nestle in during Easter, the Oreo version is packaged in a blue plastic cup to protect the egg from cracks or damage. 
Cadbury intend Easter snackers to purchase both, and have promised a different eating experience with the Oreo Creme Egg. 
T he company told the New Zealand Herald: "Cadbury Oreo Easter eggs are ideal for Cadbury Oreo chocolate lovers who can now treat themselves in the lead-up to Easter" 
"While they share a similar eating occasion, that's where the similarities end. Cadbury Creme Eggs and Cadbury Oreo Easter eggs are two very different tasting eggs."
